title: Atwood with pulley that has mass

content.question: Two blocks, one of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and one of mass <math alttext="3 M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, are connected by a massless string over a pulley that is a uniform disk of mass <math alttext="2 M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and moment of inertia <math alttext="M R squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. The two masses are released from rest, and the masses accelerate as the pulley rotates. Assume there is negligible friction between the pulley and the axle. What is the linear acceleration, <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of the masses?

choices.label: <math alttext="a equals, one third g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a equals, one half g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a equals, two fifths g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a equals, two fifths g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
